thread.title: Travel advice: Getting around for Cardiff's RWC quarter finals
thread.title_full: Travel advice: Getting around for Cardiff's RWC quarter finals | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Travel advice: Getting around for Cardiff's RWC quarter finals
text:
Cardiff's hosting two Rugby World Cup quarter final matches this weekend and fans are being urged to travel early.
New Zealand V France, Saturday 17 October 2015, KO 20:00 Ireland V Argentina, Sunday 18 October 2015, KO 13:00 Arriva trains Wales says pre-match trains will be especially busy and warns that fans may be waiting up to 2 hours for a train post match.
South Africa v Wales: what you need to know for kick off We will be adding extra capacity to our Cardiff services where possible however if you are planning to travel by train this weekend you may have to stand for some or all of your journey.
We are advising those attending the matches by rail to take the earliest possible service into Cardiff especially those travelling from Swansea, Neath, Port Talbot, Bridgend, Pencoed, Llanharan, Pontyclun and Cwmbran, Pontypool and New Inn and Abergavenny.
â€“ Arriva Trains Wales A post-match queuing system will be in place at the station and Arriva Trains Wales are advising that fans return directly to Cardiff Central Station after the matches:
Arriva Trains Wales @ArrivaTW Follow Here's our queue plan for Cardiff Central this weekend which will be in place after #NZL v #FRA and #IRE V #ARG http://t.co/fXVo70uhI3
18:03 - 16 Oct 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite There will be some diversions to buses throughout the weekend, find out more here .
As ever, parking in the centre will be restricted. You can find Park & Ride and NCP options here .
Last updated Sat 17 Oct 2015 Travel Wales Cardiff
